column4: tell me a gui way rather than commands if possible
hey i jus know my root password
thats it
yes
know i know my sudo password
It's the password you use to login to the system
hey actually i forgot my keyring unlock password can any 1 tell me how should i deactivate it
if you like Gnome2 I suggest you to consider Xfce. Ubuntu's getting rid of Gnome2 very soon.
No, 11.04 still does have Gnome2 by default, you just have to switch to it
11.10 won't, and it won't be in the repos either I suppose.
I tell you, Xfce is almost a Gnome2 clone

i dunno man, from watching the gnome3 videos i realize how unsatisfied i am w/ gnome2.. no i don't care for 3 better, but they've actually a few cool features, and i'd hate to go to a clone of 2 instead..
Just a suggestion, if you like G3 stay on it
I honestly hated it.
for the issues you raised, i agree, i don't think i'll care for it.  the workspaces and type to search for apps is all i liked, and i'd like a window manager with those features, and more.
Well you can try anything you want, it won't hurt.
btw, there's a great app for... app searching, Launchy. See http://launchy.net
nice, will check it.  Now just need a better workspace manager... seems like if something can integrate well w/ compiz it'd be pretty sweet
but can you seriously NOT resize windows?? that's too _crazy_ for me to believe!
You can resize, but to get the maximize button you have to dig with dconf a little :D
ok.. :)  Man sounds like i'm going to trip _out_ next time i reboot this computer!
...11.04 uses Unity, not Gnome3
